connector.description: Send and receive messages using the SIP protocol (used in telecommunications).

camel.sink.path.uri.name: camel.sink.path.uri
camel.sink.path.uri.description: URI of the SIP server to connect to (the username and password can be included such as: john:secretmyserver:9999)

camel.sink.endpoint.cacheConnections.name: camel.sink.endpoint.cacheConnections
camel.sink.endpoint.cacheConnections.description: Should connections be cached by the SipStack to reduce cost of connection creation. This is useful if the connection is used for long running conversations.

camel.sink.endpoint.contentSubType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.contentSubType
camel.sink.endpoint.contentSubType.description: Setting for contentSubType can be set to any valid MimeSubType.

camel.sink.endpoint.contentType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.contentType
camel.sink.endpoint.contentType.description: Setting for contentType can be set to any valid MimeType.

camel.sink.endpoint.eventHeaderName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.eventHeaderName
camel.sink.endpoint.eventHeaderName.description: Setting for a String based event type.

camel.sink.endpoint.eventId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.eventId
camel.sink.endpoint.eventId.description: Setting for a String based event Id. Mandatory setting unless a registry based FromHeader is specified

camel.sink.endpoint.fromHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.fromHost
camel.sink.endpoint.fromHost.description: Hostname of the message originator. Mandatory setting unless a registry based FromHeader is specified

camel.sink.endpoint.fromPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.fromPort
camel.sink.endpoint.fromPort.description: Port of the message originator. Mandatory setting unless a registry based FromHeader is specified

camel.sink.endpoint.fromUser.name: camel.sink.endpoint.fromUser
camel.sink.endpoint.fromUser.description: Username of the message originator. Mandatory setting unless a registry based custom FromHeader is specified.

camel.sink.endpoint.msgExpiration.name: camel.sink.endpoint.msgExpiration
camel.sink.endpoint.msgExpiration.description: The amount of time a message received at an endpoint is considered valid

camel.sink.endpoint.receiveTimeoutMillis.name: camel.sink.endpoint.receiveTimeoutMillis
camel.sink.endpoint.receiveTimeoutMillis.description: Setting for specifying amount of time to wait for a Response and/or Acknowledgement can be received from another SIP stack

camel.sink.endpoint.stackName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.stackName
camel.sink.endpoint.stackName.description: Name of the SIP Stack instance associated with an SIP Endpoint.

camel.sink.endpoint.toHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.toHost
camel.sink.endpoint.toHost.description: Hostname of the message receiver. Mandatory setting unless a registry based ToHeader is specified

camel.sink.endpoint.toPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.toPort
camel.sink.endpoint.toPort.description: Portname of the message receiver. Mandatory setting unless a registry based ToHeader is specified

camel.sink.endpoint.toUser.name: camel.sink.endpoint.toUser
camel.sink.endpoint.toUser.description: Username of the message receiver. Mandatory setting unless a registry based custom ToHeader is specified.

camel.sink.endpoint.transport.name: camel.sink.endpoint.transport
camel.sink.endpoint.transport.description: Setting for choice of transport protocol. Valid choices are tcp or udp. One of: [tcp] [udp]

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.callIdHeader.name: camel.sink.endpoint.callIdHeader
camel.sink.endpoint.callIdHeader.description: A custom Header object containing call details. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.CallIdHeader

camel.sink.endpoint.contactHeader.name: camel.sink.endpoint.contactHeader
camel.sink.endpoint.contactHeader.description: An optional custom Header object containing verbose contact details (email, phone number etc). Must implement the type javax.sip.header.ContactHeader

camel.sink.endpoint.contentTypeHeader.name: camel.sink.endpoint.contentTypeHeader
camel.sink.endpoint.contentTypeHeader.description: A custom Header object containing message content details. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.ContentTypeHeader

camel.sink.endpoint.eventHeader.name: camel.sink.endpoint.eventHeader
camel.sink.endpoint.eventHeader.description: A custom Header object containing event details. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.EventHeader

camel.sink.endpoint.expiresHeader.name: camel.sink.endpoint.expiresHeader
camel.sink.endpoint.expiresHeader.description: A custom Header object containing message expiration details. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.ExpiresHeader

camel.sink.endpoint.extensionHeader.name: camel.sink.endpoint.extensionHeader
camel.sink.endpoint.extensionHeader.description: A custom Header object containing user/application specific details. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.ExtensionHeader

camel.sink.endpoint.fromHeader.name: camel.sink.endpoint.fromHeader
camel.sink.endpoint.fromHeader.description: A custom Header object containing message originator settings. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.FromHeader

camel.sink.endpoint.listeningPoint.name: camel.sink.endpoint.listeningPoint
camel.sink.endpoint.listeningPoint.description: To use a custom ListeningPoint implementation

camel.sink.endpoint.maxForwardsHeader.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxForwardsHeader
camel.sink.endpoint.maxForwardsHeader.description: A custom Header object containing details on maximum proxy forwards. This header places a limit on the viaHeaders possible. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.MaxForwardsHeader

camel.sink.endpoint.maxMessageSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxMessageSize
camel.sink.endpoint.maxMessageSize.description: Setting for maximum allowed Message size in bytes.

camel.sink.endpoint.sipFactory.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sipFactory
camel.sink.endpoint.sipFactory.description: To use a custom SipFactory to create the SipStack to be used

camel.sink.endpoint.sipUri.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sipUri
camel.sink.endpoint.sipUri.description: To use a custom SipURI. If none configured, then the SipUri fallback to use the options toUser toHost:toPort

camel.sink.endpoint.toHeader.name: camel.sink.endpoint.toHeader
camel.sink.endpoint.toHeader.description: A custom Header object containing message receiver settings. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.ToHeader

camel.sink.endpoint.viaHeaders.name: camel.sink.endpoint.viaHeaders
camel.sink.endpoint.viaHeaders.description: List of custom Header objects of the type javax.sip.header.ViaHeader. Each ViaHeader containing a proxy address for request forwarding. (Note this header is automatically updated by each proxy when the request arrives at its listener)

camel.sink.endpoint.implementationDebugL.name: camel.sink.endpoint.implementationDebugLogFile
camel.sink.endpoint.implementationDebugL.description: Name of client debug log file to use for logging

camel.sink.endpoint.implementationServer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.implementationServerLogFile
camel.sink.endpoint.implementationServer.description: Name of server log file to use for logging

camel.sink.endpoint.useRouterForAllUris.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useRouterForAllUris
camel.sink.endpoint.useRouterForAllUris.description: This setting is used when requests are sent to the Presence Agent via a proxy.

camel.component.sip.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.sip.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.sip.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.sip.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.sip.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.sip.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
